meanings.definition: To rebound off a surface at an angle
meanings.sent1: The ball will ricochet off the wall.
meanings.sent2: The stone will ricochet off the water surface.
meanings.sent3: The rubber ball loves to ricochet off hard surfaces.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to ricochet off him, leaving no impact.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gunshot seemed to ricochet through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: The act of rebounding off a surface
meanings.sent1: The ricochet of the bullet was heard in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The loud ricochet startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ricochet of the ball made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ricochet of the music off the walls created a unique echo.
meanings.sent5: The ricochet of the light off the mirror created a dazzling effect.

meanings.definition: A shot or hit that rebounds off a surface
meanings.sent1: The tennis player's powerful serve resulted in a ricochet off the net.
meanings.sent2: The ricochet of the puck off the goalpost denied the team a goal.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ricochet of the arrow surprised the archer.
meanings.sent4: The ricochet of the bullet off the metal plate was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The ricochet of the basketball off the rim decided the game's outcome.
